page.title: 05The Sale Ground
page.content: The market in the saleyard began in the 1870's. Mr Flick and Mr Herbert Stanford of Halesworth, put their heads together and that's why they have market day on alternate Wednesdays in Saxmundham. There were stalls taking in rent for the squire of the manor before the present market actually started. The poor walked their animals to market,the rich carted them. They used to sell fat cattle, sows, poultry and geese. Now they only sell fat cattle and poultry. The numbers of cattle have gone down because the little farms in this area have died out.When the cattle have been sold they are taken to an abatoir.
